prompts.name: Job Advertisement
prompts.description: Use this template to craft an enticing job advertisement. Replace {{job title}} with the position advertised, {{primary responsibilities}} with the main tasks the job will entail, and {{required qualifications}} with the necessary attributes and qualifications.
prompts.content: Prepare a job advertisement for {{job title}}. Describe the role, {{primary responsibilities}}, and what a day on the job would look like. List {{required qualifications}}, desirable skills, and possible career advancement opportunities. Please refrain from using jargon or acronyms without explanation.

prompts.name: Interview Invitation Letter
prompts.description: This template assists in writing a formal invitation to an applicant for an interview. Substitute {{candidate's name}} with the interviewee's name, {{job title}} with the position they've applied for, and {{interview details}} with the time, location and date of the interview.
prompts.content: Draft an interview invitation letter to {{candidate's name}} for the {{job title}} position. The letter should clearly outline the {{interview details}} and provide relevant information about the interview format. Please maintain a professional tone throughout the letter.

prompts.name: Recruitment Agency Collaboration Email
prompts.description: Use this template to generate a collaboration email to a recruitment agency. Replace {{agency name}} with the designated recruitment agency, {{job vacancies}} with the positions to be filled, and {{candidate profile}} with the preferred attributes for potential candidates.
prompts.content: Send an email to {{agency name}} detailing our intent to collaborate on filling our open {{job vacancies}}. Be sure to include information about the {{candidate profile}} we are seeking and our company values. Precautions are to be taken not to share any sensitive internal information.

prompts.name: Candidate Rejection Letter
prompts.description: This template helps to construct a letter to inform a candidate their application was not successful. Change {{candidate's name}} with the concerned individual's name, {{job title}} with the role they applied for, and {{positive feedback}} with some constructive feedback on their performance.
prompts.content: Create a well-intentioned rejection letter for {{candidate's name}} who applied for the {{job title}} position. While conveying the decision, also provide some {{positive feedback}} and encouragement. Maintain a tone that is empathetic and respectful.

prompts.name: Onboarding Checklist
prompts.description: Use this template to form an effective onboarding checklist for new employees. Replace {{new employee's name}} with the name of the new hire, {{onboarding tasks}} with tasks to be completed during onboarding, and {{key contacts}} with the people the new employee should meet.
prompts.content: Compile a comprehensive onboarding checklist for {{new employee's name}}. List all relevant {{onboarding tasks}} in order of completion, starting with basic orientation and paperwork, followed by job-specific training tasks. Include {{key contacts}} within our organisation that they should know. Balance between providing enough information to be useful, without overwhelming.

prompts.name: Employment Contract
prompts.description: This template facilitates drafting detailed employment contracts. Replace {{employee's name}} with the legal name of the new hire, {{job description}} with a comprehensive outline of the role, {{terms of employment}} with the contract clauses including salary, fringe benefits, etc.
prompts.content: Draft an employment contract for {{employee's name}} containing a concise {{job description}}, clear {{terms of employment}}, confidentiality agreement, and clauses related to termination. Ensure legal conformity and clarity. Please exclude any discriminatory or biased terms.

prompts.name: Exit Interview Questionnaire
prompts.description: Use this template to compile a list of exit interview questions. Insert {{employee's name}} with the departing employee's name, {{working period}} with employeeâ€™s tenure and {{position}} with the role they held.
prompts.content: Create an exit interview questionnaire for {{employee's name}} who held the {{position}} for a {{working period}}. Include questions about their experience, suggestions for improvement, work culture, job-specific insights and reasons for leaving. Be sure to maintain a respectful and non-intrusive tone.
